Umineko Project (UP): I saw a figure, apparently the driver, open an umbrella and come towards me...
Steam (ST): I saw a shadow, which was apparently the driver, open an umbrella and come towards me...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I saw a shadow, which was apparently the driver, open an umbrella and come towards me...
PC Japanese (JP): 傘を広げ、運転手らしき人影が、私に近付いてくるのが見える…。
Russian (RU): Я увидел, как тень — очевидно, принадлежащая водителю — открыла зонтик и подошла ко мне...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu vi uma figura, que parecia ser um chofer, abrindo um guarda‐chuva e vindo na minha direção...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 能看到撐開傘的，像是司機的人影，向我靠近過來…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 能看到撑开伞的，像是司机的人影，向我靠近过来…。

Umineko Project (UP): ".........Is this your garden?"
Steam (ST): "...Is this your backyard?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Is this your garden?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「………ここはそなたの庭か？」
Russian (RU): "......Это твой сад?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Este é o seu jardim?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………這裡是汝的庭園嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………这里是汝的庭园吗？」

Umineko Project (UP): The figure questioned me.{n}Of course, I couldn't answer it...
Steam (ST): The shadow questioned me. Of course, I couldn't answer it...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The shadow questioned me. Of course, I couldn't answer it...
PC Japanese (JP): 人影は問い掛ける。無論、私には返事をすることも出来ない…。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 人影は問い掛ける。{n}無論、私には返事をすることも出来ない…。
Russian (RU): Спросила меня тень.{n}Конечно же, я не смог ответить...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A figura me questionou.{n}É claro, eu não respondi...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 人影這樣問我。{n}當然，我連回答都做不到…。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 人影这样问我。{n}当然，我连回答都做不到…。

Umineko Project (UP): "......If it is, then I must apologize. Yes, on a day with such fine weather, anyone would want to take a nap in such a lovely garden as this. ......And yet, unless my memory fails me..."
Steam (ST): "...If it is, then I must apologize. Yes, on a day with such fine weather, anyone would want to take a nap in such a lovely backyard as this. ...And yet, unless my memory fails me..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……そなたの庭ならば、私は謝らなければならないな。なるほど、このような良き天気の日には、昼寝と洒落込みたくなるような素晴らしき庭だ。……しかし、私の記憶が確かなら。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……そなたの庭ならば、私は謝らなければならないな。なるほど、このような良き天気の日には、昼寝と洒落込みたくなるような素晴らしき庭だ。……しかし、私の記憶が確かなら」
Russian (RU): "......Если да, то я прошу прощения. В день с такой хорошей погодой любой бы захотел вздремнуть в таком прекрасном саду. ......И всё же, если память меня не подводит..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Se é, então devo pedir desculpas. Sim, em um dia com um tempo tão bom desses, qualquer um iria querer tirar um cochilo em um jardim tão adorável. ......Ainda assim, se não me falha a memória..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……如果是汝的庭園，我就不得不道歉了。原來如此，像這樣好的天氣的日子，真是會讓人想隨意睡午覺一般的好庭園呢。……但是，如果我的記憶是正確的話。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……如果是汝的庭园，我就不得不道歉了。原来如此，像这样好的天气的日子，真是会让人想随意睡午觉一般的好庭园呢。……但是，如果我的记忆是正确的话。」

Umineko Project (UP): The figure crouched down and looked into my face. .........It was a woman.
Steam (ST): The shadow crouched down and looked into my face. ...It was a woman.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The shadow crouched down and looked into my face.......It was a woman.
PC Japanese (JP): 人影がしゃがみ込み、私の顔を覗く。………女だった。
Russian (RU): Тень присела на корточки и посмотрела мне в лицо. ......Это была женщина.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A figura se agachou e olhou no meu rosto. .........Era uma mulher.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 人影蹲下，看著我的臉。………是個女人。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 人影蹲下，看着我的脸。………是个女人。

Umineko Project (UP): "This is a public highway you're sleeping on. Do you want to become roadkill? ......Or maybe you already are roadkill. Well now, which one is it?"
Steam (ST): "This is a public highway you're sleeping on. Do you want to become roadkill? ...Or maybe you already are roadkill. Well now, which one is it?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「ここは天下の公道だ。そなたは挽き肉になりたいのか？　……あるいはすでに挽き肉なのか。どちらなのか教えて欲しい。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ここは天下の公道だ。そなたは挽き肉になりたいのか？　……あるいはすでに挽き肉なのか。どちらなのか教えて欲しい」
Russian (RU): "Ты спишь на общественной дороге. Хочешь, чтобы тебя задавили?......Или тебя уже задавили? Так задавили или нет?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Você está dormindo em uma rodovia pública, sabia? Quer morrer e virar guisado? ......Ou será que já está morto? Então, poderia me dizer qual dos dois?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「這裡是天下的公共道路。汝想成為肉餡嗎？……還是已經是肉餡了呢？請告訴我是哪個。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「这里是天下的公共道路。汝想成为肉馅吗？……还是已经是肉馅了呢？请告诉我是哪个。」

Umineko Project (UP): I......clenched my chest.
Steam (ST): I...clenched my chest.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 私は、……下腹に力を込める。
Russian (RU): Я...... сжал грудь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu......apertei meu peito.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我，……把力氣聚集到下腹部。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我，……把力气聚集到下腹部。

Umineko Project (UP): I felt I needed to answer somehow and establish communication.
Steam (ST): I felt I needed to answer somehow and communicate my intentions.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I felt I needed to answer somehow and communicate my intentions.
PC Japanese (JP): 何かの返事を返し、意思を疎通させなければならないと思った。
Russian (RU): Мне показалось, что нужно как‐то ответить и передать свои намерения.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Senti que precisava estabelecer algum tipo de comunicação.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 覺得想要做出回應，就必須要將意思傳達出去。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 觉得想要做出回应，就必须要将意思传达出去。

Umineko Project (UP): So, after a lot of effort, ......I managed to let a short groan escape my lips.
Steam (ST): So, finally, ...I managed to let a short groan escape my lips.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, finally, ......I managed to let a short groan escape my lips.
PC Japanese (JP): だからようやく、……うぅ、という短い唸り声を発することが出来た。
Russian (RU): Поэтому, наконец...... я сумел издать короткий стон.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, depois de muito esforço, ......consegui deixar que um breve grito escapasse pelos meus lábios.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 於是終於，……能發出“唔”的簡短呻吟聲了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 于是终于，……能发出“唔”的简短呻吟声了。

Umineko Project (UP): "......I see. So you aren't roadkill yet."
Steam (ST): "...I see. So you aren't roadkill yet."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……なるほど。まだ挽き肉ではなかったようだな。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……なるほど。まだ挽き肉ではなかったようだな」
Russian (RU): "......Ясно. Значит, ещё не задавили."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Entendi. Pelo visto, parece que ainda não morreu na estrada."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……原來如此。還不是肉餡啊。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……原来如此。还不是肉馅啊。」

Umineko Project (UP): And that.........was how I met Ikuko.
Steam (ST): And that...was how I met Ikuko.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And that......was how I met Ikuko.
PC Japanese (JP): それが私と、………幾子との出会いだった。
Russian (RU): И так...... я встретил Икуко.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E foi assim.........que eu encontrei com Ikuko.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這就是我和，………幾子的邂逅。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这就是我和，………几子的邂逅。

Umineko Project (UP): "......The body is in a very frail condition. Also, it is probable that there will be memory defects. We won't know for sure until the CT scan, but brain damage is also a possibility."
Steam (ST): "...The patient's body is in a very frail condition. Some sort of memory loss is very probable as well. We won't know for sure until the CT scan, but there may even be brain damage."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……非常に衰弱しております。あと、記憶障害の可能性が高いですな。ＣＴを見ないことにはわかりませんが、脳にダメージがある可能性もあります。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……非常に衰弱しております。あと、記憶障害の可能性が高いですな。ＣＴを見ないことにはわかりませんが、脳にダメージがある可能性もあります」
Russian (RU): "......Он в очень слабом состоянии. Кроме того, высока вероятность ухудшения памяти. Мы не узнаем наверняка до компьютерной томографии, но также не исключено повреждение мозга."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......O corpo está em uma condição muito frágil. Além disso, é provável que haja perda de memória. Não teremos certeza até a tomografia, mas não se descarta dano cerebral."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……非常地衰弱。此外，有記憶障礙的可能性也很高。雖然不照 CT 的話也不太清楚，但是有發生了腦損傷的可能性。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……非常地衰弱。此外，有记忆障碍的可能性也很高。虽然不照 CT 的话也不太清楚，但是有发生了脑损伤的可能性。」

Umineko Project (UP): "It's lucky that damage is all we have to deal with. Spend much longer in a spot like that, and things would likely have been much worse."
Steam (ST): "It's lucky that "damage" is all we have to deal with. Any longer in a spot like that, and it would likely have been much worse."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「ダメージ程度で済んで大いに結構でした。あそこであのまま寝ていれば、それどころでは済まなかったでしょうから。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ダメージ程度で済んで大いに結構でした。あそこであのまま寝ていれば、それどころでは済まなかったでしょうから」
Russian (RU): "Повезло, что это все повреждения, с которыми мы имеем дело. Если бы он пробыл там дольше, всё могло бы быть гораздо хуже."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "É muita sorte que só precisamos lidar com ferimentos. Se ficasse mais tempo naquele lugar, as coisas acabariam bem piores."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「只是損傷的程度就已經很好了。在那裡一直睡著的話，大概不僅會是這樣呢。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「只是损伤的程度就已经很好了。在那里一直睡着的话，大概不仅会是这样呢。」

Umineko Project (UP): "......True. In any event, I recommend getting this checked at a large hospital."
Steam (ST): "...True. In any event, I recommend getting this checked at a large hospital."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……ですな。何れにせよ、大きな病院で一度見せた方がいいでしょう。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……ですな。何れにせよ、大きな病院で一度診せた方がいいでしょう」
Russian (RU): "......Да. В любом случае, я рекомендую проверить это в крупной больнице."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......É verdade. Seja como for, eu recomendo que faça exames em um hospital maior."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……是啊。不管怎麼樣，還是送到大醫院再看看比較好吧？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……是啊。不管怎么样，还是送到大医院再看看比较好吧？」

Umineko Project (UP): "Thank you, Doctor. .........Please keep this off the record. It may not be much, but here's some money for your troubles."
Steam (ST): "Thank you, doctor. ...Please keep this off the record. It may not be much, but here's some money for your troubles."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Thank you, doctor. ......Please keep this off the record. It may not be much, but here's some money for your troubles."
PC Japanese (JP): 「ありがとう、先生。………この件は内密に。これはわずかですが、往診のお車代に。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「ありがとう、先生。………この件は内密に。これはわずかですが、往診のお車代に」
Russian (RU): "Спасибо, доктор. ......Я попрошу вас не распространяться об этом. Здесь немного, но возьмите как компенсацию."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Obrigada, doutor. .........Por favor, não mantenha registros disso. Pode não ser muito, mas aqui tem um pouco de dinheiro para resolver seus problemas."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「謝謝你，醫生。………這件事請保密。這是來診療的車費，雖然只有很少。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「谢谢你，医生。………这件事请保密。这是来诊疗的车费，虽然只有很少。」

Umineko Project (UP): "I see no reason to speak of this needlessly, but... ......No, no, I couldn't possibly accept that much..."
Steam (ST): "I see no reason to speak of this needlessly, but... ...no, no, I couldn't possibly accept that much..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I see no reason to speak of this needlessly, but......no, no, I couldn't possibly accept that much..."
PC Japanese (JP): 「わざわざ他言はしませんが、……いやいやっ、こんなにたくさんいただくわけには…。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「わざわざ他言はしませんが、……いやいやっ、こんなにたくさんいただくわけには…」
Russian (RU): "Я не вижу причин напрасно говорить об этом, но...... нет‐нет, я не могу взять столько..."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não vejo motivos para comentar sobre isso sem necessidade, mas... ......Não, não, eu não poderia aceitar esse tanto..."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「雖然我不會多說，……不不，也不用給這麼多…」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「虽然我不会多说，……不不，也不用给这么多…」

Umineko Project (UP): In the end, the doctor took the money and swore to keep quiet about the matter.
Steam (ST): In the end, the doctor took the money and swore to keep quiet about the matter.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 結局、医者は金を受け取り、他言はしないと誓わされた。
Russian (RU): В итоге врач взял деньги и поклялся молчать.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No fim, o médico pegou o dinheiro e jurou que ficaria em silêncio sobre o assunto.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 最後，醫生收下了錢，並發誓不會對別人講起此事。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 最后，医生收下了钱，并发誓不会对别人讲起此事。

Umineko Project (UP): Eventually, Hachijo returned.
Steam (ST): Eventually, Hachijo returned.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Eventually, Hachijo returned.
PC Japanese (JP): やがて、八城が戻ってくる。
Russian (RU): В конце концов Хачиджо вернулась.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eventualmente, Hachijo retornou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 之後，八城回來了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 之后，八城回来了。

Umineko Project (UP): "Oh, you've been awake. How do you feel...?"
Steam (ST): "Oh, you were awake. How do you feel...?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「おや、起きていたのですか。具合は如何です…？」
Russian (RU): "О, ты проснулся. Как ты себя чувствуешь?.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ora, acordou? Como está se sentindo...?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「呀，已經起來了嗎？身體感覺如何了…？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「呀，已经起来了吗？身体感觉如何了…？」

Umineko Project (UP): I nodded weakly, letting her know that it wasn't so bad for now.
Steam (ST): I nodded weakly, letting her know that it wasn't so bad for now.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 私は小さく頷き、とりあえず悪くはないことを意思表示した。
Russian (RU): Я слабо кивнул, давая ей знать, что сейчас уже не так плохо.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu assenti com fraqueza, para que ela soubesse que eu não estava tão mal.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我輕輕點頭，表示了總之是不太糟的意思。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我轻轻点头，表示了总之是不太糟的意思。

Umineko Project (UP): ......But...where is this place?{n}A room I have absolutely no memory of, ......in a house I don't remember at all.{n}And, first and foremost, here's a woman that I've never seen......
Steam (ST): ...But...where is this place? A room I have absolutely no memory of, ...in a house I don't remember at all. And, first and foremost, here's a woman I've never seen...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......But...where is this place? A room I have absolutely no memory of, ......in a house I don't remember at all. And, first and foremost, here's a woman that I've never seen......
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかし、ここはどこだろう。まったく知らない家、……まったく知らない部屋だった。そしてそれ以前に、まったく知らない女性だった……。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……しかし、ここはどこだろう。{n}まったく知らない家、……まったく知らない部屋だった。{n}そしてそれ以前に、まったく知らない女性だった……。
Russian (RU): ......Но... где я?{n}Комната, о которой у меня нет никаких воспоминаний...... в доме, который я совсем не помню.{n}И что самое главное, женщина, которую я никогда не видел......
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mas...onde fica este lugar?{n}Um cômodo do qual não tenho nenhuma recordação, ......em uma casa na qual não consigo lembrar de nada.{n}E, o mais importante de tudo, essa mulher na qual nunca antes vi......
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……但是，這裡是什麼地方呢？{n}完全不認識的家，……在完全不認識的房間裡。{n}在此之前，還有個完全不認識的女性……。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……但是，这里是什么地方呢？{n}完全不认识的家，……在完全不认识的房间里。{n}在此之前，还有个完全不认识的女性……。

Umineko Project (UP): "To start off, let me introduce myself. I'm Hachijo Ikuko. I don't mind if you address me in a friendly manner as Ikuko, or if you prefer to call me Hachijo‐san and keep things more formal."
Steam (ST): "To start off, let me introduce myself. I'm Hachijo Ikuko. Feel free to casually call me Ikuko, or act more formal and call me Hachijo-san."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "To start off, let me introduce myself. I'm Hachijo Ikuko. I don't mind if you casually call me Ikuko, or act more formal and call me Hachijo-san."
PC Japanese (JP): 「まずは私の自己紹介から。私は八城幾子。親しげに幾子と呼んでくれても、他人行儀に八城さんと呼んでくれても構いません。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「まずは私の自己紹介から。私は八城幾子。親しげに幾子と呼んでくれても、他人行儀に八城さんと呼んでくれても構いません」
Russian (RU): "Сперва я представлюсь. Хачиджо Икуко. Можешь называть меня Икуко или же оставить формальное «мисс Хачиджо», мне всё равно."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Para começar, permita que eu me apresente. Eu sou Hachijo Ikuko. Não me importo que se refira a mim de forma amigável, chamando‐me de Ikuko ou, se preferir, manter a formalidade e me chamar de Hachijo‐san."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「先從自我介紹開始。我叫八城幾子。可以親一些叫我幾子，也可以以外人禮儀叫我八城小姐。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「先从自我介绍开始。我叫八城几子。可以亲一些叫我几子，也可以以外人礼仪叫我八城小姐。」

Umineko Project (UP): ......Hachijo.........Ikuko.
Steam (ST): ...Hachijo...Ikuko.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Hachijo......Ikuko.
Russian (RU): ......Хачиджо...... Икуко.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): [=UP]

Speaker: Hachijo Ikuko
Umineko Project (UP): "The Hachijo family owns a lot of land and is well known in these parts. ......Unlike my accomplished brothers, I'm what you might call a little eccentric. After I got into a bit too much mischief than was good for me, my parents finally ran out of patience and kicked me out. I'm now confined to this house."
Steam (ST): "The Hachijo family owns a large amount of land and is fairly famous in these parts. ...Unlike my accomplished brothers, I'm what you might call a little eccentric. I got into a bit too much mischief, and my parents finally ran out of patience and kicked me out. I'm now confined to this house.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "The Hachijo family is a large landowner that's fairly well known in these parts. ......Unlike my accomplished brothers, I'm what you might call a little eccentric. After I got into a bit too much mischief than was good for me, my parents finally ran out of patience and kicked me out. I'm now confined to this house.
PC Japanese (JP): 「八城家はこの辺りではちょっと知られた大地主の名家。……出来のいい兄たちと違い、私はどこかズレた変わり者。色々と悪さが過ぎまして、とうとう親たちからも愛想を尽かされて追い出され。今はここで蟄居をさせられています。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「八城家はこの辺りではちょっと知られた大地主の名家。……出来のいい兄たちと違い、私はどこかズレた変わり者。色々と悪さが過ぎまして、とうとう親たちからも愛想を尽かされて追い出され。今はここで蟄居をさせられています」

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「那么，到你想起自己的名字之前，以 18 这个年龄，给你写作十八读作 TOOYA 的名字吧？……八城十八。如何？嗯，还挺不错的。自卖自夸，嗯嗯。」

Umineko Project (UP): Hachijo......Ikuko gave a satisfied laugh.
Steam (ST): Hachijo...Ikuko gave a satisfied laugh.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 八城……幾子は、ほくほくと笑う。
Russian (RU): Хачиджо...... Икуко довольно усмехнулась.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Hachijo......Ikuko riu satisfeita.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 八城……幾子她，呵呵地笑著。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 八城……几子她，呵呵地笑着。

Umineko Project (UP): From then on, I took the name Hachijo Tohya.
Steam (ST): From then on, I took the name Hachijo Tohya.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): From then on, I took the name Hachijo Tohya.
PC Japanese (JP): 私は、八城十八と名乗ることになった。
Russian (RU): С тех пор я взял имя Хачиджо Тойя.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De agora em diante, eu adotei o nome Hachijo Tohya.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我此後，就被冠以了八城十八的名字。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我此后，就被冠以了八城十八的名字。

Umineko Project (UP): My inability to move my body was apparently due to a traffic accident.
Steam (ST): My inability to move my body was apparently due to a traffic accident.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): My inability to move my body was apparently due to a traffic accident.
PC Japanese (JP): 体がうまく動かないのは、恐らく交通事故のせいだという。
Russian (RU): Моя неспособность двигаться, по‐видимому, была связана с дорожным происшествием.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Minha incapacidade de mover meu corpo provavelmente é devida a um acidente de trânsito.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 身體無法很好地行動，大概是因為交通事故吧？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 身体无法很好地行动，大概是因为交通事故吧？

Umineko Project (UP): On that day, I had been hit by a car, and Ikuko had picked me up from where I lay on the street.
Steam (ST): On that day, I had been hit by a car, and Ikuko had picked me up from where I lay on the street.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): On that day, I had been hit by a car, and Ikuko had picked me up from where I lay on the street.
PC Japanese (JP): 私はあの日、あそこで車にはねられ、倒れているところを、幾子に拾われたのだ。
Russian (RU): В тот день меня сбила машина, и Икуко забрала меня оттуда, где я лежал на улице.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Naquele dia, quando fui atingido por um carro, a Ikuko me juntou de onde eu estava caído na rua.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我在那一天，在那裡被車撞倒，之後被幾子撿了回來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我在那一天，在那里被车撞倒，之后被几子捡了回来。

Umineko Project (UP): If she hadn't hit the brakes...
Steam (ST): If she hadn't hit the brakes...
Original Witch Hunt (OG): If she hadn't hit the brakes...
PC Japanese (JP): もし彼女がブレーキを踏んでくれなかったら。
Russian (RU): Если бы она не надавила на тормоза...
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Se ela não tivesse pisado no freio...
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 如果她沒有踩剎車的話。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 如果她没有踩刹车的话。

Umineko Project (UP): She probably would've driven straight onwards, thinking she'd run over a dead dog or something.
Steam (ST): She probably would've driven straight onwards, thinking she'd run over a dead dog or something.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She probably would've driven straight onwards, thinking she'd run over a dead dog or something.
PC Japanese (JP): 犬の死骸でも踏んだかな程度に思われ、彼女はそのまま走り去っていただろう。
Russian (RU): Она, наверное, поехала бы прямо вперёд, думая, что проедет по мёртвой собаке.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela provavelmente teria passado direto por cima de mim, pensando que havia batido em um cachorro morto ou outro animal.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 大概她會覺得是壓到了死狗，就這麼離去吧？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 大概她会觉得是压到了死狗，就这么离去吧？

Umineko Project (UP): ......Later on, I—perhaps rudely—suspected that the one who hit me might have been Ikuko herself, but when I saw her completely undamaged front bumper, I gave up on that theory.
Steam (ST): ...Later on, perhaps rudely, I suspected that the one who hit me might have been Ikuko herself, but when I saw her completely undamaged front bumper, I gave up on that theory.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Later on, I, perhaps rudely, suspected that the one who hit me might have been Ikuko herself, but when I saw her completely undamaged front bumper, I gave up on that theory.
PC Japanese (JP): ……ひょっとして、私をはねたのが、他ならぬ彼女なのではないかという失礼な想像も後に浮かんだが、彼女の車の傷一つないバンパーを見て、その推理を引っ込めるた。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ……ひょっとして、私をはねたのが、他ならぬ彼女なのではないかという失礼な想像も後に浮かんだが、彼女の車の傷一つないバンパーを見て、その推理を引っ込めた。
Russian (RU): ......Хотя это было грубо, позже я заподозрил, что меня сбила сама Икуко, но отказался от этого предположения, увидев совершенно неповреждённый передний бампер её машины.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Mais tarde, eu — possivelmente de maneira indelicada — suspeitei que aquela que me atingiu poderia ter sido a própria Ikuko, mas quando vi que a frente do carro estava completamente lisa, eu abandonei essa teoria.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……雖然也失禮地想過，說不定撞了我的就是她吧，但是看到她的車上毫無傷痕的保險杠，就捨棄了這個推理。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……虽然也失礼地想过，说不定撞了我的就是她吧，但是看到她的车上毫无伤痕的保险杠，就舍弃了这个推理。

Umineko Project (UP): Hachijo Ikuko lived in a small but lovely mansion on the top of a small hill, in a village with a view of the sea.
Steam (ST): Hachijo Ikuko lived in a small but lovely mansion on the top of a small hill, in a village with a view of the sea.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Hachijo Ikuko lived in a small but lovely mansion on the top of a small hill, in a village with a view of the sea.
PC Japanese (JP): 八城幾子は、海の見える町の、小高い丘の上に、小さいがとても立派な邸宅に住んでいた。
Russian (RU): Хачиджо Икуко жила в маленьком, но прекрасном особняке на вершине небольшого холма, в деревне с видом на море.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Hachijo Ikuko vivia em uma pequena, mas adorável, mansão no topo de uma pequena colina, em um vila com vista para o mar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 八城幾子住在能看到海的都市的，有些高的小山丘上的，雖小但很漂亮的宅邸裡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 八城几子住在能看到海的都市的，有些高的小山丘上的，虽小但很漂亮的宅邸里。

Umineko Project (UP): She also owned the hill behind her and was more than capable of enjoying the four seasons in privacy.
Steam (ST): She also owned the hill behind her and was more than capable of enjoying the four seasons in privacy.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She also owned the hill behind her and was more than capable of enjoying the four seasons in privacy.
PC Japanese (JP): 裏山も持ち、豊かな四季をプライベートに楽しむことも出来た。
Russian (RU): Также ей принадлежал холм позади неё, и она более чем могла в уединении любоваться четырьмя временами года.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela também era dona da colina que ficava atrás e era mais do que capaz de aproveitar as quatro estações com total privacidade.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 還有後山，可以充分享受私人的四季。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 还有后山，可以充分享受私人的四季。

Umineko Project (UP): As time passed slowly, my rehabilitation continued, and my ability to move improved little by little.
Steam (ST): As time passed slowly, my rehabilitation continued, and my ability to move improved little by little.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): As time passed slowly, my rehabilitation continued, and my ability to move improved little by little.
PC Japanese (JP): ゆっくりと時間を掛けて、リハビリを進め、私は体の自由を少しずつ取り戻していった。
Russian (RU): Время медленно шло, моя реабилитация продолжалась, и способность двигаться постепенно улучшалась.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Com o tempo passando lentamente, minha reabilitação continuou e minhas habilidades de locomoção foram melhorando aos poucos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 時間慢慢過去，經過康復療法，我的身體逐漸取回了自由。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 时间慢慢过去，经过康复疗法，我的身体逐渐取回了自由。

Umineko Project (UP): However, ......it seemed I really had suffered some form of brain damage.
Steam (ST): However, ...it seemed I really did suffer some form of brain damage.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, ......it seemed I really did suffer some form of brain damage.
PC Japanese (JP): ただ、……やはり、脳に障害が残っているらしい。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): ただ、……やはり、脳にダメージが残っているらしい。
Russian (RU): Но...... повреждение мозга осталось.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entretanto, ......parece que eu realmente sofri um dano cerebral.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，……果然，大腦還是留下了些傷害。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，……果然，大脑还是留下了些伤害。

Umineko Project (UP): Finding out who I was.........looked like it would be a very difficult task.
Steam (ST): Finding out who I was...looked like it would be a very difficult task.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Finding out who I was......looked like it would be a very difficult task.
PC Japanese (JP): 私が何者なのかを知るのは、………とても難しそうだった。
Russian (RU): Похоже, выяснить, кем я был...... будет очень трудно.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Descobrir quem eu era.........se tornou uma tarefa muito difícil.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 要知道我自己是什麼人，………還是非常困難的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 要知道我自己是什么人，………还是非常困难的。

Umineko Project (UP): In the beginning, when I couldn't bear not knowing my identity, my head often hurt so much it felt as though it would explode.
Steam (ST): In the beginning, when I couldn't bear not knowing my identity, my head often hurt so much it felt as though it would explode.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In the beginning, when I couldn't bear not knowing my identity, my head often hurt so much it felt as though it would explode.
PC Japanese (JP): 初めの頃は、自分の正体がわからないもどかしさに、頭が割れそうな痛みを訴えることも多かった。
Russian (RU): Вначале, когда я не мог вынести незнания своей личности, у меня часто так сильно болела голова, что казалось, будто она сейчас расколется.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No começo, quando eu não conseguia suportar não saber a minha identidade, minha cabeça costumava doer tanto que eu sentia como se ela fosse explodir.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 一開始的時候，由於焦急於不知道自己的身份，頭疼得像要裂開的情況很多。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 一开始的时候，由于焦急于不知道自己的身份，头疼得像要裂开的情况很多。

Umineko Project (UP): ......However, as I slowly accepted the fact that I was a new person, with the new name of Hachijo Tohya, ......the headaches became less frequent.
Steam (ST): ...However, as I slowly accepted the fact that I was a new person, with the new name of Hachijo Tohya, ...the headaches became less frequent.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): ……しかし、自分が八城十八という新しい名を与えられた、新しい人間なのだということを少しだけ受け容れられるようになると、……頭痛の頻度は少しずつ減っていった。
Russian (RU): ......Но когда я постепенно принял то, что я новый человек с новым именем Хачиджо Тойя, ......головные боли стали возникать реже.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Contudo, conforme eu lentamente ia aceitando o fato de que eu era uma nova pessoa, com o novo nome de Hachijo Tohya, ......a frequência das dores de cabeça foi diminuindo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……但是，在稍微接受了自己被賜予了八城十八這個新名字，作為新的人生存之後，……頭疼的頻率逐漸減少了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……但是，在稍微接受了自己被赐予了八城十八这个新名字，作为新的人生存之后，……头疼的频率逐渐减少了。

Umineko Project (UP): The whole time, ......no memories returned to me except the fact that I had been eighteen.
Steam (ST): That whole time, ...no memories returned to me except the fact that I had been 18.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): The whole time......no memories returned to me except the fact that I had been 18.
PC Japanese (JP): 相変わらず、……自分が１８歳だったという記憶しか、蘇らない。
Russian (RU): За всё время...... ко мне не вернулось никаких воспоминаний, за исключением того, что мне 18.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Durante todo o tempo, ......nenhuma memória retornou além do fato de que eu tinha dezoito anos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 還是那樣，……只能想起自己是 18 歲這點記憶。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 还是那样，……只能想起自己是 18 岁这点记忆。

Umineko Project (UP): However, I was unable to remember any more, unable even to be sure that eighteen was my true age, ......and eventually, I stopped trying to remember my former self.
Steam (ST): However, I was unable to remember any more, unable even to be sure that 18 was my true age, ...and eventually, I stopped trying to remember my former self.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, I was unable to remember any more, unable even to be sure that 18 was my true age, ......and eventually, I stopped trying to remember my former self.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、それ以上のことを思い出せず、そして１８歳という年齢さえも正しいのかわからず、……私はやがて、かつての自分を思い出そうとすることもやめた。
Russian (RU): Однако я не смог вспомнить больше, даже не мог убедиться, что 18 — мой настоящий возраст, ......и в конце концов я перестал пытаться вспомнить прежнего себя.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entretanto, eu fui incapaz de lembrar qualquer outra coisa, incapaz até mesmo de ter certeza se eu realmente tinha dezoito anos, ......e eventualmente, eu parei de tentar me lembrar do meu antigo eu.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是再想下去也想不出來，而且連 18 這個年齡到底是不是正確的都不知道，……我最終，放棄了回憶過去的自己。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是再想下去也想不出来，而且连 18 这个年龄到底是不是正确的都不知道，……我最终，放弃了回忆过去的自己。

Speaker: Hachijo Ikuko
Umineko Project (UP): "Good morning, Tohya. That was quite the storm last night. Were you able to sleep well?"
Steam (ST): "Good morning, Tohya. That was quite the storm last night. Were you able to sleep well?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「おはよう、十八。昨日はひどい嵐でしたが、よく眠れましたか。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「おはよう、十八。昨日はひどい嵐でしたが、よく眠れましたか」
Russian (RU): "Доброе утро, Тойя. Прошлой ночью был такой шторм. Удалось выспаться?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Bom dia, Tohya. A tempestade da noite passada foi bem forte. Conseguiu dormir bem?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「早上好，十八。昨天刮了很強的暴風雨，你睡得還好嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「早上好，十八。昨天刮了很强的暴风雨，你睡得还好吗？」

Speaker: Hachijo Tohya
Umineko Project (UP): ".........I had some trouble falling asleep. So, I decided to read your manuscript."
Steam (ST): "......I had some trouble falling asleep. So, I decided to read your manuscript."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「………なかなか寝付けませんでした。だから、幾子さんの書いた原稿を読んでいました。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………なかなか寝付けませんでした。だから、幾子さんの書いた原稿を読んでいました」
Russian (RU): ".........Заснуть было сложно. Поэтому я решил прочитать вашу рукопись."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Eu tive um pouco de dificuldade para dormir. Por isso decidi ler o seu manuscrito."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「………基本沒睡著。所以，我就去讀幾子小姐你寫的原稿了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………基本没睡着。所以，我就去读几子小姐你写的原稿了。」

Speaker: Hachijo Ikuko
Umineko Project (UP): "My, my. How far did you manage to get?"
Steam (ST): "My, my. How far did you manage to get?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「おやおや。どこまで読んでくれたのですか。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「おやおや。どこまで読んでくれたのですか」
Russian (RU): "Надо же. И где ты сейчас?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ora, ora. Até onde você foi?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「哦呀哦呀。讀到哪裡了呢？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「哦呀哦呀。读到哪里了呢？」

Speaker: Hachijo Tohya
Umineko Project (UP): "I finished it."
Steam (ST): "I finished it."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「全部読み終えました。」
Russian (RU): "Я закончил."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu terminei."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「全都讀完了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「全都读完了。」

Speaker: Hachijo Ikuko
Umineko Project (UP): "......Now there's a surprise. You managed to read through all that in a single night?"
Steam (ST): "...Now there's a surprise. You managed to read through all that in a single night?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……これは驚いた。あの量の原稿用紙を、一晩で読み切ったというのですか。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……これは驚いた。あの量の原稿用紙を、一晩で読み切ったというのですか」
Russian (RU): "......Вот так сюрприз. Ты прочитал всё за одну ночь?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Isso sim é uma surpresa. Você leu tudo em uma única noite?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……這可真讓人吃驚。那麼多的稿紙，居然在一晚內就讀完了嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……这可真让人吃惊。那么多的稿纸，居然在一晚内就读完了吗？」

Speaker: Hachijo Tohya
Umineko Project (UP): "I was surprised too. ......Once I got into it, I'd finished before I knew it. ......It was like I was just skimming it, ......or maybe like I was reading each page in a glance......"
Steam (ST): "I was surprised too. ...Once I got into it, I'd finished before I knew it. ...It was like I was just skimming it, ...or maybe like I was taking in each page with just a glance..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「私も驚いています。……夢中になっていたら、あっという間に読めてしまって。……文章を斜めに読むというか、原稿用紙全体を一度に見るというべきか……。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「私も驚いています。……夢中になっていたら、あっという間に読めてしまって。……文章を斜めに読むというか、原稿用紙全体を一度に見るというべきか……」
Russian (RU): "Я сам удивился. ......Начав, я не успел осознать, как закончил. ......Будто я просто листал её...... или, может, пробегал взглядом по каждой странице......"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu também fiquei surpreso. ......Assim que comecei, acabei terminando antes de me dar conta. ......Foi como se eu só estivesse lendo por cima, ......ou talvez eu estivesse lendo cada página só de olhar pra ela......"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我也很驚訝。……看入迷了之後，很快就看完了。……應該說是斜著讀文章呢，還是將稿紙一次全看完呢……？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我也很惊讶。……看入迷了之后，很快就看完了。……应该说是斜着读文章呢，还是将稿纸一次全看完呢……？」

Speaker: Hachijo Ikuko
Umineko Project (UP): "It sounds like you have some talent at speed reading. ......So, how was it? What did you think of it?"
Steam (ST): "It sounds like you have some talent at speed reading. ...So, how was it? What did you think of it?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「どうやらそなたは、速読の心得があるようですね。……して、どうでしたか。感想は。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「どうやらそなたは、速読の心得があるようですね。……して、どうでしたか。感想は」
Russian (RU): "Видимо, у тебя талант в скоростном чтении. ......И как? Что скажешь?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Parece que você tem um certo talento para ler rapidamente. ......Então, como foi? O que achou?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「看來汝是有著速讀的心得呢。……那麼，如何呢？有什麼感想。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「看来汝是有着速读的心得呢。……那么，如何呢？有什么感想。」

Speaker: Hachijo Tohya
Umineko Project (UP): "I liked it a lot. Still, if you don't explain that part about the ocean currents a bit more clearly, it might be a little unfair for the reader... Oh, but I thought it was great that you had the foreshadowing with the ring right there at the beginning."
Steam (ST): "I liked it a lot. Still, if you don't explain that part about the ocean currents a bit more clearly, it might be a little unfair for a detective novel... Oh, but I thought it was great that you had the foreshadowing with the ring right there at the beginning.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I liked it a lot. Still, if you don't explain that part about the ocean currents a bit more clearly, it might be a little unfair for the reader... Oh, but I thought it was great that you had the foreshadowing with the ring right there at the beginning.
PC Japanese (JP): 「とても面白かったです。ただ、海流についての説明がもう少しないと、推理小説としてはアンフェアかもしれませんね…。でも、指輪についての伏線が、冒頭から出ていたのは、とても面白かったです。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「とても面白かったです。ただ、海流についての説明がもう少しないと、推理小説としてはアンフェアかもしれませんね…。でも、指輪についての伏線が、冒頭から出ていたのは、とても面白かったです」

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「非常有趣。但是，不針對海流再多說明一些的話，作為推理小說可能會有些不公平呢…。但是，關於戒指的伏筆在一開始就出現這點，非常地有意思。」

Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這個結果，就是她被給予了這個家，命令她要在這裡獨自隱居。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这个结果，就是她被给予了这个家，命令她要在这里独自隐居。

Umineko Project (UP): She had never been a particularly social person, so she happily accepted this new state of affairs, living however she pleased with servants to take care of her.
Steam (ST): She had never been a particularly social person, so she happily accepted this new state of affairs, living however she pleased with servants to take care of her.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She had never been a particularly social person, so she happily accepted this new state of affairs, living however she pleased with servants to take care of her.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼女は元々、社交的な性格ではなかったらしく、それを喜んで受け入れ、ここで使用人たちに身の回りの世話をさせながら、悠々自適に暮らしているらしい。
Russian (RU): Она была не особо общительным человеком, поэтому с радостью приняла новое положение дел, живя как пожелает в особняке со слугой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela nunca chegou a ser uma pessoa particularmente sociável, por isso aceitou de bom grado essa sua nova condição de vida, vivendo como bem entendesse e com empregados para cuidar dela.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她原本就是不擅長社交的性格，於是高興地接受了這個條件，在這裡接受著傭人們的貼身照顧，悠閑自得地生活在這裡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她原本就是不擅长社交的性格，于是高兴地接受了这个条件，在这里接受着佣人们的贴身照顾，悠闲自得地生活在这里。

Umineko Project (UP): She had no friends. No one ever came to visit.
Steam (ST): She had no friends. No one ever came to visit.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She had no friends. No one ever came to visit.
PC Japanese (JP): 友人はいない。尋ねてくる者もない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 友人はいない。訪ねてくる者もない。
Russian (RU): У неё не было друзей. К ней никто никогда не приходил.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela não tinha amigos. Ninguém vinha visitá‐la.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 沒有朋友。也沒有探訪者。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 没有朋友。也没有探访者。

Umineko Project (UP): Besides me, the only one she ever talked to was Bern, an old black cat she kept as a pet.
Steam (ST): When I wasn't around, she only ever talked to an old black cat she kept as a pet, named Bern.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When I wasn't around, she only ever talked to an old black cat she kept as a pet, named Bern.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼女が話し掛けるのは、私がいなかったらペットの老いた黒猫、ベルンだけだ。
Russian (RU): Когда меня не было рядом, она разговаривала только со старой чёрной кошкой по кличке Берн, которая была её домашним питомцем.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Além de mim, a única com quem ela conversava era a Bern, uma velha gata preta que ela cuidava.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 能和她說話的，除了我就只有作為寵物的老黑貓，貝倫而已。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 能和她说话的，除了我就只有作为宠物的老黑猫，贝伦而已。

Umineko Project (UP): I didn't know her real age.
Steam (ST): I don't know her real age.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I don't know her real age.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼女の実際の年齢はわからない。
Russian (RU): Я не знаю её настоящий возраст.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu não sei a sua idade real.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我不知道她的真實年齡。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我不知道她的真实年龄。

Umineko Project (UP): She didn't seem to be too old to marry yet, but she wasn't likely to meet anyone new leading an isolated life like this.
Steam (ST): She doesn't seem to be too old to marry yet, but with an isolated life like this, she isn't likely to meet people.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She doesn't seem to be too old to marry yet, but with an isolated life like this, she isn't likely to meet people.
PC Japanese (JP): 婚期的には、まだ取り返しのつく年齢らしいが、こんなところで一人で隠居していては、出会いもあるわけがない。
Russian (RU): Ещё не похоже, что она в том возрасте, когда пора выходить замуж, но с такой уединённой жизнью она вряд ли с кем‐нибудь встречается.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ela não parece ser velha demais para casar, mas ela dificilmente encontraria alguém enquanto vivesse uma vida isolada dessas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 從結婚上來說，還是可以有所進展的年齡，但因為獨自隱居在這種地方，完全沒有什麼邂逅。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 从结婚上来说，还是可以有所进展的年龄，但因为独自隐居在这种地方，完全没有什么邂逅。

Umineko Project (UP): Despite her insistence that she just hadn't met anyone worth the trouble, I felt as though she'd already given up on marriage.
Steam (ST): She sometimes says that she just hasn't met anyone worth the trouble, but I think she's already given up on marriage.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She sometimes says that she just hasn't met anyone worth the trouble, but I think she's already given up on marriage.
PC Japanese (JP): たまたま良い出会いがないだけだと言い張る彼女だが、多分、結婚はもう、諦めているのだろう。
Russian (RU): Иногда она говорит, что просто не встретила никого, кто стоил бы проблем, но, думаю, она уже не стремится выйти замуж.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Apesar da sua insistência de que ela apenas não tinha encontrado ninguém que valesse a pena, eu senti como se ela já tivesse desistido de se casar.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 雖然她偶爾會說只是沒有好的邂逅而已，但她大概是，已經放棄結婚了吧？
Chinese Simplified (CN): 虽然她偶尔会说只是没有好的邂逅而已，但她大概是，已经放弃结婚了吧？

Umineko Project (UP): Her everyday life changed very little.
Steam (ST): Her everyday life was very simple.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Her everyday life was very simple.
PC Japanese (JP): 彼女の日々は、とても単調だ。
Russian (RU): Её повседневная жизнь была очень проста.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sua vida ordinária pouco mudou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 她的生活十分地單調。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 她的生活十分地单调。

Umineko Project (UP): She would either read through the many detective novels that were brought to her, or else write detective novels herself.
Steam (ST): She would either read through the many detective novels that were brought to her, or else write detective novels herself.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): She would either read through the many detective novels that were brought to her, or else write detective novels herself.
PC Japanese (JP): 取り寄せた推理小説の数々を読み漁るか、あるいは自ら推理小説を執筆するか、そのどちらかだった。
Russian (RU): Она либо читала множество детективов, которые ей покупали, либо сама писала детективы.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Ou ela lia os diversos romances policiais que eram trazidos para ela, ou ela escrevia suas próprias obras.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 要麼就是閱讀寄來的那些推理小說，要麼就是自己來寫推理小說，就只有這兩樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 要么就是阅读寄来的那些推理小说，要么就是自己来写推理小说，就只有这两样。

Umineko Project (UP): At first, I thought she was some novelist at a private retreat, plugging away at a new book.
Steam (ST): At first, I thought she was some novelist at a private retreat, plugging away at a new book.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At first, I thought she was some novelist at a private retreat, plugging away at a new book.
PC Japanese (JP): 最初は、庵に隠居して原稿に勤しむ小説家なのかと思った。
Russian (RU): Сначала я подумал, что она ушедший в отставку романист, корпящий над новой книгой.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): No começo, eu pensei que ela fosse alguma escritora em um retiro privado, desconectando‐se para escrever um novo livro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 一開始，我認為她是隱居在草堂裡勤於寫作的小說家。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 一开始，我认为她是隐居在草堂里勤于写作的小说家。

Umineko Project (UP): However, the manuscripts she finished just ended up clipped together in a pile.
Steam (ST): However, the manuscripts she finished just ended up clipped together in a pile.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, the manuscripts she finished just ended up clipped together in a pile.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、彼女が書き上げた原稿は、目玉クリップで留められ山積みにされるだけ。
Russian (RU): Но её рукописи всегда оказывались свалены в одну кучу.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Mas os manuscritos que ela terminava acabavam sendo grampeados em uma pilha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，她寫出來的原稿，只是被夾子夾起來堆在一起。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，她写出来的原稿，只是被夹子夹起来堆在一起。

Umineko Project (UP): With me as the sole exception, it didn't look like she gave them to anyone else to read.
Steam (ST): With me as the sole exception, it didn't look like she ever let anyone read them.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): With me as the sole exception, it didn't look like she ever let anyone read them.
PC Japanese (JP): 自分という例外を除けば、誰にも読ませているようには見えなかった。
Russian (RU): Не похоже, что она давала читать их кому‐либо, кроме меня.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Sendo eu a única exceção, não parecia que ela os dava para outras pessoas lerem.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 除了自己之外，看不出來是想讓別人來讀。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 除了自己之外，看不出来是想让别人来读。

Umineko Project (UP): A novelist is someone who writes novels for other people to read.
Steam (ST): A novelist is someone who writes novels for people to read.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): A novelist is someone who writes novels for people to read.
PC Japanese (JP): 小説家というのは、人に読ませるために小説を書く職業のことだ。
Russian (RU): Романист — это тот, кто пишет романы, чтобы люди их читали.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Escritores são pessoas que escrevem livros para que os outros leiam.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所謂的小說家，是書寫讓人看的小說的職業。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所谓的小说家，是书写让人看的小说的职业。

Umineko Project (UP): So, I figured you could hardly call her a novelist when she kept writing novels no one would ever read.
Steam (ST): So, I figured you could hardly call her a novelist when she kept writing novels no one would ever see.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, I figured you could hardly call her a novelist when she kept writing novels no one would ever read.
PC Japanese (JP): だから人に読ませない小説ばかりを書く彼女は、多分、小説家とは呼ばないに違いないと思った。
Russian (RU): Поэтому её вряд ли можно назвать романистом, раз она продолжает писать романы, которые никто никогда не прочитает.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por isso, eu percebi que era muito difícil chamá‐la de escritora quando ela continuava a escrever obras que ninguém lia.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以我覺得總是寫不讓別人看的小說的她，大概，不能稱作是小說家。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以我觉得总是写不让别人看的小说的她，大概，不能称作是小说家。

Speaker: Hachijo Tohya
Umineko Project (UP): "......Ikuko‐san, why don't you ever show these to anyone?"
Steam (ST): "...Ikuko-san, why don't you ever show these to anyone?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......Ikuko-san, why don't you ever show these to anyone?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「……幾子さんは、なぜこの原稿を誰かに見せようとしないのですか。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……幾子さんは、なぜこの原稿を誰かに見せようとしないのですか」
Russian (RU): "......Икуко, почему вы никому их не показываете?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Ikuko‐san, por que você nunca mostra a ninguém?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……幾子小姐你為什麼不讓別人看這些原稿呢？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……几子小姐你为什么不让别人看这些原稿呢？」

Speaker: Hachijo Ikuko
Umineko Project (UP): "I show them to you. Only the better ones, of course."
Steam (ST): "I show them to you. Only the better ones, of course."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「そなたには見せています。無論、出来のマシなものに限りますが。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そなたには見せています。無論、出来のマシなものに限りますが」
Russian (RU): "Я показываю тебе. Только лучшие, разумеется."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu mostro para você. Apenas as melhores, é claro."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「會讓汝看的。當然，僅限於寫得比較好的。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「会让汝看的。当然，仅限于写得比较好的。」

Speaker: Hachijo Tohya
Umineko Project (UP): "Haven't you ever thought of sending one to some publishing company? ......It's a shame for things to be this way, when your works are so interesting."
Steam (ST): "Haven't you ever thought of sending one to some publishing company? ...It's a waste otherwise, when your works are so interesting."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「例えば、どこかの出版社に応募してみるとか。……幾子さんの作品は、とても面白いのに、残念ですよ。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「例えば、どこかの出版社に応募してみるとか。……幾子さんの作品は、とても面白いのに、残念ですよ」
Russian (RU): "Разве вы не думали отправить их в издательство?......Жаль, что так происходит, когда ваши работы такие интересные."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Nunca pensou em enviar alguma obra para uma editora? ......É uma pena as coisas serem assim, sendo que seus trabalhos são tão interessantes."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「比如說，試試去投稿給哪個出版社之類的？……幾子小姐的作品，明明很精彩的，真是遺憾。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「比如说，试试去投稿给哪个出版社之类的？……几子小姐的作品，明明很精彩的，真是遗憾。」

Speaker: Hachijo Ikuko
Umineko Project (UP): "My works can't stand up against the pros. I sent one in once, but it was absolutely no good. I understand my position. This is just an amateur's pastime."
Steam (ST): "My works can't stand up against the pros. I sent one in once, but it was absolutely no good. I understand my position. This is just an amateur's pastime."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「私の作品など、プロには通じぬ。一度送ったことがあるが、さっぱり駄目でした。私にはわかっています。こんなもの、素人の道楽です。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「私の作品など、プロには通じぬ。一度送ったことがあるが、さっぱり駄目でした。私にはわかっています。こんなもの、素人の道楽です」
Russian (RU): "Мои работы не могут конкурировать с профи. Как‐то раз я отправила одну, но ничего не вышло. Я понимаю своё положение. Это всего лишь времяпрепровождение любителя."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Meus trabalhos não se comparam aos profissionais. Eu os envio de tempos em tempos, mas nunca dá certo. Eu entendo a minha posição. É apenas um passatempo amador."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我的作品，夠不上專業人士的眼光。曾經投過一次，但是完全不行。我知道的。這種東西，只是外行人的娛樂。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我的作品，够不上专业人士的眼光。曾经投过一次，但是完全不行。我知道的。这种东西，只是外行人的娱乐。」

Speaker: Hachijo Tohya
Umineko Project (UP): "I don't think "amateur" is a fitting word for someone who's so well‐versed in detective novels from all times and places across the world."
Steam (ST): "I don't think amateur is a fitting word for someone who's so well-versed in detective novels from all times and all across the world."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I don't think amateur is a fitting word for someone who's so well-versed in detective novels from all times and all across the world."
PC Japanese (JP): 「あれだけ古今東西の様々な推理小説に精通していて、素人ということはないと思います。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「あれだけ古今東西の様々な推理小説に精通していて、素人ということはないと思います」
Russian (RU): "Не думаю, что «любитель» — подходящее слово для той, кто так хорошо разбирается в детективных романах всех времён и народов."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu não acho que a palavra "amador" é adequada para alguém tão versada em romances policiais de todas as eras e cantos do planeta."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「明明精通著古今東西的各種推理小說，我並不認為你是個外行人。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「明明精通着古今东西的各种推理小说，我并不认为你是个外行人。」

Speaker: Hachijo Ikuko
Umineko Project (UP): "Being a big eater doesn't mean you'll make a good cook. Reading every detective novel you can get your hands on provides no guarantee of being a good detective novelist. That's how it is. That's why this is nothing more than a pastime."
Steam (ST): "Being a big eater doesn't mean you'll make a good cook. Reading every detective novel you can get your hands on is no guarantee that you're a good detective novelist. That's how it is. That's why this is nothing more than a pastime."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Being a big eater doesn't mean you'll make a good cook. Reading every detective novel you can get your hands on is no guarantee that you're a good detective novelist. That's how it is. That's why this is nothing more than a pastime."
PC Japanese (JP): 「大飯喰らいが、良き料理人になれるわけでもない。推理小説を読み散らすことが、良き推理小説家であることを保証するわけでもない。そういうことです。だからこんなものは、道楽に過ぎません。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「大飯喰らいが、良き料理人になれるわけでもない。推理小説を読み散らすことが、良き推理小説家であることを保証するわけでもない。そういうことです。だからこんなものは、道楽に過ぎません」
Russian (RU): "Гурман не всегда хороший повар. Читая каждый детективный роман, который попадает в твои руки, ещё не получаешь гарантию, что ты хороший писатель детективов. Вот и всё. Именно поэтому это не более чем времяпрепровождение."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Ser comilona não significa ser uma boa cozinheira. Ler todas as obras de mistério que você pode obter em suas mãos não dá nenhuma garantia que você será um bom escritor. É assim que as coisas são. Por isso, não é mais do que um passatempo."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「吃得多，不代表就能成為好廚師。讀遍推理小說，也不能保證我就是個好的推理小說家。就是這樣。所以這不過就是自我娛樂而已。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「吃得多，不代表就能成为好厨师。读遍推理小说，也不能保证我就是个好的推理小说家。就是这样。所以这不过就是自我娱乐而已。」

Speaker: Hachijo Tohya
Umineko Project (UP): "......Is it really fun to write novels that you won't show to anyone?"
Steam (ST): "...Is it really fun to write novels that you won't show to anyone?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……誰にも見せない小説を書くことは、本当に楽しいですか？」
Russian (RU): "......Так ли уж интересно писать романы, которые никому не покажешь?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......É mesmo tão divertido escrever livros que você não mostra a ninguém?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……寫不讓任何人看到的小說，真的覺得高興嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……写不让任何人看到的小说，真的觉得高兴吗？」

Speaker: Hachijo Ikuko
Umineko Project (UP): "It used to be. ......Once."
Steam (ST): "It used to be. ...Once."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「かつては楽しかった。……かつては。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「かつては楽しかった。……かつては」
Russian (RU): "Было интересно. ......Когда‐то."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Costumava ser. ......Certa vez."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「過去還是很高興的。……過去。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「过去还是很高兴的。……过去。」

Speaker: Hachijo Tohya
Umineko Project (UP): "What about now?"
Steam (ST): "What about now?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「今は？」
Russian (RU): "А сейчас?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "E agora?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「現在呢？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「现在呢？」

Speaker: Hachijo Ikuko
Umineko Project (UP): "I like getting to hear your opinions. .........At any rate, I've finished writing the chapter. I'll go make some tea, so would you mind reading it again and sharing your thoughts with me?"
Steam (ST): "I like getting to hear your opinions. ......At any rate, I've finished writing the chapter. I'll go make some tea, so would you mind reading it again and sharing your thoughts with me?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「そなたに感想を得ることが楽しい。………とりあえず、一章を書き終えました。お茶を用意させるので、また読んで感想を聞かせてもらえませんか。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「そなたに感想を得ることが楽しい。………とりあえず、一章を書き終えました。お茶を用意させるので、また読んで感想を聞かせてもらえませんか」
Russian (RU): "Мне нравится слушать твои мнения. .........Я закончила писать главу. Пойду сделаю чай, так что прочитай и поделись снова своими мыслями."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu gosto de poder ouvir as suas opiniões. .........Seja como for, eu já terminei de escrever o capítulo. Irei fazer um pouco de chá. Se importaria de ler novamente e compartilhar seus pensamentos comigo?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「以得到汝的感想為樂趣。………總之，我寫完一章了。我去給你準備茶，你能再來看看然後告訴我感想嗎？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「以得到汝的感想为乐趣。………总之，我写完一章了。我去给你准备茶，你能再来看看然后告诉我感想吗？」

Umineko Project (UP): Saying this with a smile, Ikuko thrust a pile of manuscript paper at me.
Steam (ST): Saying this with a smile, Ikuko thrust a pile of manuscript paper at me.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Dizendo isso com um sorriso, a Ikuko largou uma pilha de manuscritos sobre mim.

Chinese Simplified (CN): 几子这样说着，微笑着把一叠稿纸递向我。

Umineko Project (UP): When it comes to detective novels, reading and writing are the same.{n}It's boring if you just do it by yourself.
Steam (ST): I'm convinced that, whether you read detective novels or write them... They're boring if you're all on your own.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): When it comes to detective novels, reading and writing are the same. It's boring if you just do it by yourself.
PC Japanese (JP): 推理小説は、読むのも書くのもきっと同じ。自分ひとりだけじゃ、つまらない。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 推理小説は、読むのも書くのもきっと同じ。{n}自分ひとりだけじゃ、つまらない。
Russian (RU): О прочтении и написании детективов можно сказать одно и то же.{n}Скучно читать и писать их в одиночку.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Quando se trata de romances policiais, ler e escrever é a mesma coisa.{n}É chato se fizer isso sozinho.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 推理小說，無論寫和讀肯定都一樣。{n}只有自己一人的話，很無聊。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 推理小说，无论写和读肯定都一样。{n}只有自己一人的话，很无聊。

Umineko Project (UP): You only get something really precious when you share the world with someone else.
Steam (ST): You can only find something really precious when you share that world with someone else.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): You only get something really precious when you share the world with someone else.

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Você só obtém algo realmente precioso quando compartilha esse mundo com outra pessoa.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 和誰一起來共有世界之後，才會開始覺得，……有什麼重要的事情擴展開來。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 和谁一起来共有世界之后，才会开始觉得，……有什么重要的事情扩展开来。

Steam (ST): "Tohya? ...Are you okay? I'll go get some headache medicine."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「十八？……振作些？我马上拿头疼药来。」

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「大丈夫です。それより原稿を。新章が楽しみです」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): A estação passou.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 四季流轉。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 四季流转。

Umineko Project (UP): Together with Ikuko, in this town whose name I didn't even know, I spent my days debating detective novels and talking about ideas for new plots.
Steam (ST): Together with Ikuko, in this town whose name I didn't even know, we spent our days debating detective novels and talking about ideas for new plots.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Together with Ikuko, in this town whose name I didn't even know, we spent our days debating detective novels and talking about ideas for new plots.
PC Japanese (JP): 私は幾子と二人で、この名も知らぬ町で、日々を推理小説の議論と、新しい小説のプロットのアイデアについて話し合って過ごした。
Russian (RU): Вместе с Икуко, в этом городке, названия которого я даже не знал, мы обсуждали детективные романы и высказывали идеи для новых сюжетов.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Junto com a Ikuko, nesta cidade na qual eu nem sei o nome, eu passei meus dias discutindo sobre romances policiais e conversando sobre ideias para novas tramas.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我和幾子兩人，在這不知名的小鎮，每日討論推理小說，以及構想新的小說來度過時光。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我和几子两人，在这不知名的小镇，每日讨论推理小说，以及构想新的小说来度过时光。

Umineko Project (UP): At a glance, they may have appeared to be stale and unproductive days.
Steam (ST): At a glance, they may have appeared to be stale and unproductive days.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At a glance, they may have appeared to be stale and unproductive days.

Russian (RU): На первый взгляд эти дни могли показаться чёрствыми и непродуктивными.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): De relance, poderiam ter parecido dias obsoletos e nada produtivos.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 這乍看起來，和原本的日子沒什麼兩樣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 这乍看起来，和原本的日子没什么两样。

Steam (ST): However, ...Hachijo Tohya found satisfaction with this new life.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, ......Hachijo Tohya found satisfaction with this new life.

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): でも、……八城十八としての、新しい人生としては、満ち足りたものだった。
Russian (RU): Но...... Хачиджо Тойю устраивала новая жизнь.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Entretanto, ......eu encontrei a satisfação na minha nova vida como Hachijo Tohya.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，……這對於作為八城十八的新的人生來說，已經足夠了。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，……这对于作为八城十八的新的人生来说，已经足够了。

Speaker: Hachijo Ikuko
Umineko Project (UP): "......And so, the curtain closes on the strange tale of Kurokubi Island. .........The End."
Steam (ST): "...And so, the curtain closes on the strange tale of Kurokubi Island. ...The End."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "......And so, the curtain closes on the strange tale of Beatnik Island. ......The End."

PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……“斯様にして、我が黒首島奇譚は幕を閉じるのである。”………＜了＞」

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……“如此，我这黑首岛奇谭落下帷幕。”………＜完＞。」

Umineko Project (UP): With a dramatic flourish of her fountain pen, Ikuko signified that her manuscript was now complete.
Steam (ST): With a dramatic flourish of her pen, Ikuko signified that her manuscript was now complete.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): With a dramatic flourish of her pen, Ikuko signified that her manuscript was now complete.

Russian (RU): Резким росчерком пера Икуко закончила свою рукопись.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Gesticulando dramaticamente com sua caneta‐tinteiro, Ikuko exprimiu que seu manuscrito agora estava completo.

Speaker: Hachijo Ikuko
Umineko Project (UP): "What do you think...?! I tried using your plot to make Tsujiko's tragic love scene at the end a bit more moving."
Steam (ST): "What do you think...?! I tried using your plot to make Tsujiko's tragic love scene at the end a bit more moving."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「どうであるか…！　そなたのプロットを活かしつつ、最後に辻子の悲恋をもう少し厚くしてみました。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「どうであるか…！　そなたのプロットを活かしつつ、最後に辻子の悲恋をもう少し厚くしてみました」
Russian (RU): "Что скажешь?! Я придерживалась твоего сюжета, чтобы последняя сцена трагической любви Цуджико вышла более трогательной."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "O que achou...?! Eu tentei usar o seu enredo para fazer a trágica cena de amor da Tsujiko no final ser um pouco mais comovente."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「如何啊…！由於汝安排的情節，最後辻子的悲戀顯得更真摯了。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「如何啊…！由于汝安排的情节，最后辻子的悲恋显得更真挚了。」

Speaker: Hachijo Tohya
Umineko Project (UP): "I think it's very good...... I think the last farewell is sad enough to make it moving as a story, not just a reasoning puzzle."
Steam (ST): "I think it's very good... I'd say the last farewell is sad enough to make it moving as a story, not just a reasoning puzzle."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「とても良いと思います……。最後の別れが悲しく、推理物としてだけでなく、読み物としても厚みが出たと思います。」

Russian (RU): "Очень даже неплохо...... По‐моему, последнее прощание достаточно печально, чтобы получилась история, а не простая головоломка рассуждений."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu achei muito bom...... Acredito que a última despedida é triste o bastante para fazer dela uma história comovente, e não apenas algo para se investigar e raciocinar."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我覺得非常好……。最後的離別的悲傷，不僅是對於推理文章，作為讀物來說也能夠體現出厚重感。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我觉得非常好……。最后的离别的悲伤，不仅是对于推理文章，作为读物来说也能够体现出厚重感。」

Speaker: Hachijo Ikuko
Umineko Project (UP): "......That's thanks to your plot. ......Compared to this work, everything I've written before now is worth little more than scrap paper. ......Even as I was writing it, I was excited to be the first person in the world who got to read it. ......I've never felt that before."
Steam (ST): "...That's all thanks to your plot. ...Compared to this work, everything I've written before now is worth little more than scrap paper. ...Even as I was writing it, I was excited to be the first person in the world who got to read it. ...I've never felt that before."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): [=UP]
PC Japanese (JP): 「……十八のプロットがあればこそです。……この作品の前には、私がこれまで書き溜めた原稿など、ちり紙の価値さえない。……書きながらも、私が世界で一番最初の読者であることの興奮。……こんな経験は初めてです。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「……十八のプロットがあればこそです。……この作品の前には、私がこれまで書き溜めた原稿など、ちり紙の価値さえない。……書きながらも、私が世界で一番最初の読者であることの興奮。……こんな経験は初めてです」
Russian (RU): "......Всё благодаря твоему сюжету. ......По сравнению с этой работой, всё, что я написала до сих пор, стоит немногим больше макулатуры. ......Даже во время написания я была так взволнованна тем, что я первая, кто её читает. ......Никогда не испытывала ничего подобного."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "......Tudo graças a sua ideia. ......Comparado com este trabalho, tudo que eu escrevi até então não vale mais do que um pedaço de papel amassado. ......Até enquanto escrevia, eu estava empolgada de ser a primeira pessoa do mundo que iria ler. ......Eu nunca me senti assim antes."
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「……這是因為有十八你的構思。……在這部作品之前，我過去寫的那些文章，連衛生紙的價值都沒有。……寫著的時候，我也有著身為世界上第一個讀者的興奮。……這樣的經驗還是頭一次。」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「……这是因为有十八你的构思。……在这部作品之前，我过去写的那些文章，连卫生纸的价值都没有。……写着的时候，我也有着身为世界上第一个读者的兴奋。……这样的经验还是头一次。」

Speaker: Hachijo Tohya
Umineko Project (UP): "I just mentioned some ideas. You're the one who turned them into such a fascinating story, Ikuko‐san."
Steam (ST): "I just mentioned some ideas. You're the one who turned them into such a fascinating story, Ikuko-san."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I just mentioned some ideas. You're the one who turned them into such a fascinating story, Ikuko-san."
PC Japanese (JP): 「私はアイデアを出しただけです。それを、ここまで立派な読み物に昇華してくれたのは、全て幾子さんの筆のお陰です。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「私はアイデアを出しただけです。それを、ここまで立派な読み物に昇華してくれたのは、全て幾子さんの筆のお陰です」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Eu só dei algumas ideias. Foi você quem as transformou em uma história tão fascinante, Ikuko‐san."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我只是提出了想法而已。将之升华为如此好看的读物的，全都是几子小姐的文笔。」

Umineko Project (UP): Before I knew it, she had roped me in as well, and I too had dipped my toe into the world of detective novel writing.
Steam (ST): At some point, she roped me in as well, and I too started my journey in the world of writing detective novels.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): At some point, she roped me in as well, and I also started my journey in the world of writing detective novels.
PC Japanese (JP): いつしか彼女に誘われるようにして、私も推理小説を執筆する世界に足を踏み入れていた。
Russian (RU): Ни с того ни с сего она и меня заманила в мир написания детективных романов.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Antes que eu me desse conta, ela também já tinha me prendido e eu também havia mergulhado no mundo da escrita dos romances policiais.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 何時起我被她邀請，也踏入了寫作推理小說的世界。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 何时起我被她邀请，也踏入了写作推理小说的世界。

Umineko Project (UP): ......Apparently, the old me had possessed some knowledge of mysteries and detective novels and the like.
Steam (ST): ...Apparently, the old me had some talent for mysteries and detective novels and the like.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ......Apparently, the old me had some talent for mysteries and detective novels and the like.
PC Japanese (JP): ……かつての私は、推理小説というかミステリーというか、そういうものに多少の心得があったらしい。
Russian (RU): ......Видимо, прежний я был талантлив в загадках, детективах и тому подобном.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ......Pelo que parece, o antigo eu tinha algum conhecimento sobre mistérios e romances policiais.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): ……好像過去的我，對推理小說或者推理劇這類的東西，多少有些心得的樣子。
Chinese Simplified (CN): ……好像过去的我，对推理小说或者推理剧这类的东西，多少有些心得的样子。

Umineko Project (UP): And my talent seemed to be of a fairly unorthodox kind.
Steam (ST): And, my talent seemed to be of a fairly unorthodox kind.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): And, my talent seemed to be of a fairly unorthodox kind.
PC Japanese (JP): そしてそれらに、相当、斜な角度から切り込んでいたようだ。
Russian (RU): И, похоже, мой талант весьма оригинальный.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): E meu talento parecia ser bem heterodoxo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 並且還是，以相當奇怪的角度切入進去的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 并且还是，以相当奇怪的角度切入进去的。

Umineko Project (UP): I turned famous mysteries from across the world on their head, always looking to twist those ideas into something new.
Steam (ST): I tried turning famous mysteries from across the world on their head, twisting those ideas into something new.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): I tried turning famous mysteries from across the world on their head, twisting those ideas into something new.
PC Japanese (JP): 私は古今東西の有名ミステリーを逆手に取り、アイデアだけは斬新なものをと考え続けた。
Russian (RU): Я переворачивал с ног на голову известные детективы со всего мира и придумывал новые идеи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Eu fui reunindo ideias de famosos mistérios de todos os cantos do mundo na minha cabeça, sempre buscando distorcer essas ideias em algo novo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我反之利用古今東西的各種有名的推理劇，只構思新的想法。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我反之利用古今东西的各种有名的推理剧，只构思新的想法。

Umineko Project (UP): However, a few ideas aren't enough to make a book.
Steam (ST): However, a few ideas aren't enough to make a book.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): However, a few ideas aren't enough to make a book.
PC Japanese (JP): しかし、アイデアだけで作品が仕上がったら、これほど楽なことはない。
Russian (RU): Но нескольких идей мало для книги.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Contudo, algumas poucas ideias não eram o bastante para fazer um livro.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 但是，完成只有想法的作品，並不是那麼有趣。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 但是，完成只有想法的作品，并不是那么有趣。

Umineko Project (UP): No meal is complete if all you can do is chop up vegetables.
Steam (ST): No meal is complete if all you can do is chop up vegetables.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): No meal is complete if all you can do is chop up vegetables.
PC Japanese (JP): 野菜をぶつ切りにしただけでは、どんな料理だって完成しないのだ。
Russian (RU): Нельзя завершить приготовление еды, если можешь лишь нарезать овощи.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Nenhuma refeição está completa se tudo o que você consegue fazer é cortar os vegetais.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 只是把蔬菜給切好，是無法完成料理的。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 只是把蔬菜给切好，是无法完成料理的。

Umineko Project (UP): It was thanks to Ikuko's writing, a skill she had built up over many years, that my ideas were transformed into a work of fiction.
Steam (ST): Thanks to Ikuko's writing, a skill she had built up over many years, my ideas were transformed into a work of fiction.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Thanks to Ikuko's writing, a skill she had built up over many years, my ideas were transformed into a work of fiction.
PC Japanese (JP): その私のアイデアを、幾子は長年培ってきた筆力で作品に昇華してくれた。
Russian (RU): Благодаря навыку написания, который Икуко построила за многие года, мои идеи преобразовались в художественное произведение.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Foi graças a escrita da Ikuko, uma habilidade que ela desenvolveu ao longo de muitos anos, que as minhas ideias foram transformadas em uma obra de ficção.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我的這些想法，被幾子長年鍛鍊出來的文筆給升華為作品。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我的这些想法，被几子长年锻炼出来的文笔给升华为作品。

Umineko Project (UP): This first work that we had authored together, "The Strange Tale of Kurokubi Island", had brought out the best of our individual quirks, ......and, though I hate to brag, it had turned into a masterpiece that we could show to anyone without shame.
Steam (ST): In this work, "the Strange Tale of Kurokubi Island", the two of us merged the best of our respective personalities, ...and, though I hate to brag, it had turned into a masterpiece that we could show to anyone without shame.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): In this work, 'the Strange Tale of Beatnik Island', the two of us merged the best of our respective personalities, ......and, though I hate to brag, it had turned into a masterpiece that we could show to anyone without shame.
PC Japanese (JP): 初めて二人で書き上げた、この「黒首島奇譚」は、二人の素晴らしい個性を活かしあった、……内輪褒めで恐縮だが、誰に見せても恥ずかしくない、傑作だった。
Russian (RU): В этой работе, «Странная история острова Беатник», мы вдвоём объединили лучшее из своих личностей, ......и, хотя я ненавижу хвастаться, она превратилась в шедевр, который не стыдно показать другим.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Essa primeira obra em que criamos juntos, "O Estranho Conto da Ilha Kurokubi", trouxe à tona o melhor das nossas habilidades individuais, ......e, embora eu odeie me gabar, acabou se tornando uma obra‐prima que nós poderíamos mostrar a qualquer um sem ter vergonha.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 第一次由兩人一起寫出來的，這「黑首島奇譚」是，發揮了兩個人最好的個性，……雖然是自誇，但的確是給任何人看都不會覺得丟臉的傑作。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 第一次由两人一起写出来的，这「黑首岛奇谭」是，发挥了两个人最好的个性，……虽然是自夸，但的确是给任何人看都不会觉得丢脸的杰作。

Speaker: Hachijo Ikuko
Umineko Project (UP): "Hello? Please bring us some champagne. ......Bring a glass for yourself as well. This is the best work ever created within these walls. Let's celebrate."

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Hello? Please bring us some champagne. ......Bring a glass for yourself as well. This is the best job we've done so far, so let's celebrate."
PC Japanese (JP): 「もしもし？　書斎にシャンパンを持って来て下さい。……グラスはあなたの分も。これまでで一番の作品が仕上がりました。お祝いしましょう。」

Steam (ST): Ikuko called for some champagne over the internal phone line.

PC Japanese (JP): 幾子が内線電話でシャンパンを持って来させる。

Umineko Project (UP): Joined by the servant who happened to be working that day and the cat Bern, we raised our glasses high and toasted our accomplishment.
Steam (ST): Joined by the servant who happened to be working that day and the cat Bern, we raised our glasses high and toasted our accomplishment.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Joined by the servant who happened to be working that day and the cat Bern, we raised our glasses high and toasted our accomplishment.
PC Japanese (JP): 私たちは、その日の当番だった使用人とベルンを交えての三人と一匹で、高々とグラスを掲げて乾杯をした。
Russian (RU): Вместе со слугой, которой довелось работать в этот день, и кошкой Берн мы высоко подняли бокалы и поддержали наше достижение тостами.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Junto ao empregado que estava trabalhando no dia e a gata Bern, nós erguemos nossas taças e brindamos nossa realização.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 我們那天，算上值班的傭人以及貝倫，三人加一只，高高地舉杯乾杯。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 我们那天，算上值班的佣人以及贝伦，三人加一只，高高地举杯干杯。

Steam (ST): "......Ikuko-san, I have an idea, if you don't mind."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): ".........Ikuko-san. I have an idea, if you don't mind."
PC Japanese (JP): 「………幾子さん。提案があるんだけれど、いいですか。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「………幾子さん。提案があるんだけれど、いいですか」

Brazilian Portuguese (PT): ".........Ikuko‐san. Eu tenho uma ideia, caso não se importe."

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「………几子小姐。我有个提案，可以说吗？」

Speaker: Hachijo Ikuko
Umineko Project (UP): "Let's hear it. There is never a wrong time for your ideas, as long as I'm not in the shower or on the can...!"

Original Witch Hunt (OG): "Let's hear it. I love hearing your ideas, as long as I'm not in the shower or on the can...!"
PC Japanese (JP): 「聞こう。そなたの話すアイデアなら、シャワーとトイレ中でなければ、いつだって耳を貸そう…！」
Russian (RU): "Говори. Твои идеи я буду слушать когда угодно, пока я не в душе или на толчке!.."
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Vamos ouvi‐la. Nunca é a hora errada para as suas ideias, desde que eu não esteja no banho ou aos pés...!"

Chinese Simplified (CN): 「说吧？你所说的想法，只要不是在洗澡或是上厕所的时候，我都会听的…！」

Russian (RU): "Почему бы нам не отправить нашу книгу?......Я никогда не читал ничего интереснее. Наверняка и многие другие захотят прочитать её."

Steam (ST): Outside, it had started to rain. ...It reminded me of the day Ikuko-san found me and took me in.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Outside, it had started to rain.......It reminded me of the day Ikuko-san found me and took me in.
PC Japanese (JP): 外はいつの間にか雨が降っていた。……私が幾子さんに拾われたあの日のことを思い出す。
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 外はいつの間にか雨が降っていた。{n}……私が幾子さんに拾われたあの日のことを思い出す。
Russian (RU): Снаружи начался дождь.{n}......Он напомнил мне о том дне, когда Икуко нашла меня.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Do lado de fora, a chuva começava a cair.{n}......Isso me lembrou o dia em que a Ikuko‐san me encontrou e me deu abrigo.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 外面不知何時下起了雨。{n}……讓我想起我被幾子小姐揀到的那天。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 外面不知何时下起了雨。{n}……让我想起我被几子小姐拣到的那天。

Umineko Project (UP): Because of that, ......whenever it rains, I find myself wondering who I was, ......and I usually get headaches.
Steam (ST): Because of that, ...whenever it rains, I find myself wondering who I was, ...and I usually get headaches.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): Because of that, ......whenever it rains, I find myself wondering who I was, ......and I usually get headaches.

Russian (RU): Из‐за этого...... всякий раз, когда идёт дождь, я задаюсь вопросом, кто я...... и обычно зарабатываю головную боль.
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): Por causa disso, ......sempre que chove, eu me encontro pensando quem sou eu, ......e normalmente acabo com dor de cabeça.
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 所以，一下雨，……我就會開始想自己是什麼人，……很容易引發頭痛。
Chinese Simplified (CN): 所以，一下雨，……我就会开始想自己是什么人，……很容易引发头痛。

Umineko Project (UP): So, I wasn't sure whether the pain was because of the rain or because I drank too much.
Steam (ST): So, I wasn't sure whether the pain was because of the rain or because I drank too much.
Original Witch Hunt (OG): So, I wasn't sure whether the pain was because of the rain or because I drank too much.

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria

Steam (ST): "I've always been a witch. ...You approached that level yourself once, didn't you?"

Speaker: Ushiromiya Ange
Umineko Project (UP): "No. I never really understood. ......I felt sorry for you and your magic. ......I could {i:only} feel sorry for you... .........So, ......I couldn't pick up a fragment of happiness, couldn't even find one. .........You told me that yourself once, Onee‐chan......"
Steam (ST): "No. I never really understood. ...Pitiful Maria onee-chan with her pitiful magic. ...That's all I thought of it... ...So, ...I couldn't pick up a Fragment of happiness, couldn't even find one. ...You told me that yourself once, ...Onee-chan..."
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "No. I never really understood. ......Pitiful Maria onee-chan with her pitiful magic. ......That's all I thought of it... ......So, ......I couldn't pick up a Fragment of happiness, couldn't even find one. ......You told me that yourself once, ......Onee-chan......"
PC Japanese (JP): 「うぅん。本当の意味でわかってなんかいなかった。……可哀想な真里亞お姉ちゃんの可哀想な魔法。……そんな風にしか見ていなかった…。………だから、……私には幸せのカケラが拾えない、見つけられない。………かつてお姉ちゃんは私に、……そう言ったわ……。」
PS3 Japanese - Censored (JPC): 「うぅん。本当の意味でわかってなんかいなかった。……可哀想な真里亞お姉ちゃんの可哀想な魔法。……そんな風にしか見ていなかった…。………だから、……私には幸せのカケラが拾えない、見つけられない。………かつてお姉ちゃんは私に、……そう言ったわ……」
Russian (RU): "Нет. Я никогда не понимала по‐настоящему. ......Жалкая сестрёнка Мария со своей жалкой магией. ......Вот и всё, о чём я думала... ......Поэтому...... я не могла вытянуть фрагмент счастья, не могла даже найти его. ......Ты сама однажды сказала мне это...... сестрёнка......"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Não. Eu nunca entendi de verdade. ......Eu senti muito por você e sua magia. ......Eu {i:só} podia sentir muito por você... .........Por isso, ......eu não fui capaz de colher um Fragmento de felicidade, sequer consegui encontrar um. .........Certa vez, você mesma me disse isso......"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「不。我根本沒明白真正的意義。……可怜的真里亞姐姐和可怜的魔法。……我當時只認為是這樣…。………所以，……我撿不到幸福的碎片，也找不到。………過去姐姐你，曾經對我，……這樣說過……」

Speaker: Ushiromiya Maria
Umineko Project (UP): "......It can't be helped. It takes two to create a universe. ......I had Beato, but you were all alone."

Umineko Project (UP): ".........All of it is my fault. The message bottles I threw into the sea for fun caused a distortion in your future and wore you down. ......I bear responsibility for that."

Umineko Project (UP): "I'm pretty sure you know this, ......but Bern is just about to hold a big party for the Book of the Single Truth. She's gathered beings from heaven and from hell, from the spirit world and from parallel worlds. If she announces what's in that book in a place like that, it'll all be too late, won't it?"
Steam (ST): "I think you know this already, ...but Bern is just about to hold a big party for the Book of the Single Truth. She's gathered beings from heaven and from hell, from the spirit world and from parallel worlds. If she announces what's in that book in a place like that, it'll all be too late, won't it?"
Original Witch Hunt (OG): "I think you know this already, ......but Bern is just about to hold a big party for the Book of the Single Truth. She's gathered beings from heaven and from hell, from the spirit world and from parallel worlds. If she announces what's in that book in a place like that, it'll all be too late, won't it?"
PC Japanese (JP): 「あんたも知ってると思うけど。……ベルンはもうじき、一なる真実の書をパーティーで大公開するわ。会場には、天国から地獄から、異界から別世界から、あらゆる世界の面々が集まってる。そこで中身を公表されたら、もう何もかも手遅れよ？」
Russian (RU): "Думаю, вы уже знаете, ......но Берн вот‐вот закатит грандиозную вечеринку в честь книги единственной правды. Она собрала существ с небес, из ада, из мира духов и параллельных миров. Если она объявит там содержимое этой книги, всё будет кончено, так?"
Brazilian Portuguese (PT): "Tenho certeza que você sabe disso, ......mas a Bern está prestes a sediar uma grande festa pelo Livro da Única Verdade. Ela reuniu existências do Céu e do Inferno, do mundo dos espíritos e mundos paralelos. Se ela anunciar em um lugar desses o conteúdo do livro, vai ser tarde demais, não?"
Chinese Traditional (CHT): 「我想你也知道。……貝倫馬上，就要把唯一真實之書在宴會上大公開了。會場裡，聚集了從天國從地獄，從異界從別的世界，從各種世界前來的人。內容在那裡被公開的話，就一切都晚了喲？」
Chinese Simplified (CN): 「我想你也知道。……贝伦马上，就要把唯一真实之书在宴会上大公开了。会场里，聚集了从天国从地狱，从异界从别的世界，从各种世界前来的人。内容在那里被公开的话，就一切都晚了哟？」
